definition: lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to hang or suspend/to worry/public announcement/unresolved/baseless/without foundation
precipice/cliff/Taiwan pr. [yai2]
to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux
to strap tightly/to bind
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: The impression of the splendour of Tianya, reality into the brink.
sentences.chinese: 印象中的蝶舞天涯，現實中成了懸崖勒馬。

sentences.english: We need consumers who will hold their feet to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要懸崖勒馬的用戶。

definition: open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
readily following good advice (idiom); willing to accept other people's views
to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
abuse of authority
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
to waste all one's previous efforts (idiom)/all that has been achieved goes down the drain
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
